name: 現代醫學
goals: Discussions on recent medical advances will be guided to help students think outside the box on possible impacts of the technologies and practice expressing their own views.
Students will work in groups to present an international medical breakthrough in technology or knowledge and be prepared to respond to critiques from their classmates.
Students will be equipped with the skills to carry out lifelong learning to keep abreast of current medical issues in society.
syllabus:
One article/video clip will be selected every week from the suggested online resources below for one group of students to present their understanding and thoughts. Discussions will be guided towards currently debated issues.

（Time Magazine: [https://time.com/](https://time.com/)

Nature Magazine: [https://www.nature.com/](https://www.nature.com/)

Medical News Today: [https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/)

Washington Post, health section: [https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/?itid=nb\_health](https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/?itid=nb_health)

Youtube Channels: Cleveland Clinic, Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins Medicine, etc.

Medical news in easy English: [https://www.english-online.at/news-articles/health-medicine/health-index.htm](https://www.english-online.at/news-articles/health-medicine/health-index.htm)

VoA articles and video clips in three English difficulty levels: [https://learningenglish.voanews.com/z/955](https://learningenglish.voanews.com/z/955)

The articles/video clip will be updated two weeks in advance.

Week 1 – Class introduction 

Week 2 – Diabetes 糖尿病

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ozoVpPULySo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ozoVpPULySo)

Discussions will center on technology’s role in diabetes treatment, including major tech companies Apple’s and Google’s plans.
==============================================================================================================================

Week 3 – Depression 

[https://time.com/6105717/on-loving-someone-who-battles-inner-demons/](https://time.com/6105717/on-loving-someone-who-battles-inner-demons/)

Discussions will center on the most common mental health disorders, including depression and its prevention and treatment.
==========================================================================================================================

Week 4 – Dementia 

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tkIg-SxPzTA](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tkIg-SxPzTA)

Discussions will be based on the TED talk: Alzheimer’s is Not Normal Aging

Week 5 – Vaccines 

[https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/scientists-say-vaccine-patch-more-effective-than-injections/6253301.html](https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/scientists-say-vaccine-patch-more-effective-than-injections/6253301.html)

Discussions will be based on this article: Scientists say vaccine patch more effective than injections.
=======================================================================================================

Week 6 – Acute Myocardial Infarction

[https://time.com/6106052/aspirin-heart-attack-guidance/](https://time.com/6106052/aspirin-heart-attack-guidance/)

Discussions will be based on the use of aspirin on treating and preventing heart attacks.

Week 7 – Osteoarthritis 

[https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/7621#types](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/7621#types)

Discussions will center on arthritis and current treatment options.

Week 8 – Prosthetic limbs 

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6RzSjhrwYXs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6RzSjhrwYXs)

Discussions will be based on the clip: Bionic Skin Lets Amputees Feel Their Missing Limbs Again.
================================================================================================

Week 9 – Stroke 

[https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/brain-embolism](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/brain-embolism)

Discussions will center on brain embolisms and encourage students to share their knowledge or personal experience from knowing someone who has suffered a stroke.
=================================================================================================================================================================

Week 10 – Cosmetic surgery

[https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/lip-flip#what-to-consider](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/lip-flip#what-to-consider)

Discussions will be based on the different types of cosmetic surgery being offered today.

Week 11 – Hair transplants 

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pd1gxKP0ejU](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pd1gxKP0ejU)

Students will watch this clip on hair transplants and discuss how they feel about artificially growing hair on patients’ scalps. Clip: Surgeon Reacts to Elon Musk's Hair Transplant
====================================================================================================================================================================================

Week 12 – IVF and egg freezing 

[https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/320228#pregnancy-around-menopause](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/320228#pregnancy-around-menopause)

The issues surrounding reproductive biology will be discussed focusing on this article: What to know about menopause and pregnancy
==================================================================================================================================

Week 13 – Cancer 

[https://time.com/6102568/breast-cancer-screenings-wisdom-study/](https://time.com/6102568/breast-cancer-screenings-wisdom-study/)

Discussions will surround current cancer treatment.

Week 14 – Asthma 

[https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(21)02244-3/fulltext](https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(21)02244-3/fulltext)

Students will discuss asthma and the standard treatment guidelines.

Week 15 – Organ transplants 

[https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/us-scientists-successfully-attached-pig-kidney-to-human/6278615.html](https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/us-scientists-successfully-attached-pig-kidney-to-human/6278615.html)

Students will discuss organ transplants (human-human, animal-human, self-self) and what medical technology can do nowadays.
===========================================================================================================================

Week 16 – Lasik 

[https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2020/04/30/jameis-winston-can-read-street-signs-after-lasik-will-that-reduce-his-interceptions/](https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2020/04/30/jameis-winston-can-read-street-signs-after-lasik-will-that-reduce-his-interceptions/)

Discussions will be based on this article on laser eye surgery and its benefit on sports players.
=================================================================================================

Week 17 – Burns 

[https://www.healthline.com/health/skin-cell-gun](https://www.healthline.com/health/skin-cell-gun)

Discussions will center of burns and stem cell guns.

Week 18 – end of term oral presentation

methodologies.note: Teacher brief on the article/video clip of the week as well as related background information.
Critique, feedback and debate from classmates on the weekly group presentation.
Discussion on problems encountered researching the weekly presentation topic.
Group work in presentation preparation and delivery.
Online videos related to the weekly topic will be selectively utilized. Online scientific and medical magazines will be used for reading and discussions.
Topics of discussion will encourage students to think critically on current medical news.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
